result.execSummary:
The defendant Korea K Beck was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Misappropriate ID Info - Obtain Money, a class H felony, Wisconsin Statutes 943.201(2)(a).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change. Terminated - institution.

10:07 AM Defendant Korea K Beck in court, in custody.   District Attorney's Office Law Intern appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Korea K Beck appeared by video means.  Case called for defendant's eligibility for the Substance Abuse Program or Challenge Incarceration Program.  The state takes no position in this instance. 
The court orders the defendant is eligible for the Substance Abuse Program and Challenge Incarceration Program.
The court will prepare an amended judgment of conviction.
Review hearing on May 9, 2019 at 10:00 am.

records.addlTxt: Notice of Case Status Change - Revoked - Sentenced to Prison
with Elements of criminal offenses to which plea is being entered.

Defendant Korea K Beck in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Pablo Galaviz appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Defendant pleads guilty to count #1.  Court finds the defendant guilty of count #1.  State gives recommendations.  Attorney Weathers makes statements.  Defendant makes statements. 

The Court Orders the Following: Count #1
Imposed and Stayed Sentence of:
4 Years Imprisonment (Credit - 0 days )
2 Years of Initial Confinement
2 Years of Extended Supervision
 
Term of Probation: 3 Years
Conditions of Probation:
Follow through with any treatment and/or counseling recommended by Agent;
No contact with Elizabeth N.M.
Agent to manage or overview over any financial transactions, sign any and all releases
Condition Time: 120 days Huber with work, school, and childcare, Consecutive.  Court stays the last 90 of the 120 days.  To report to huber after her Ozaukee County sentence.  
Restitution: $1038.88 to be paid to BMO Harris to be paid as a condition of probation
COSTS:  $ 278.00  to be paid as a condition of probation
DNA waived
Felony warnings, immigration warnings,  voting rights and firearms warnings given.
Plea/sentencing hearing on October 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Korea K Beck in court with attorney M. Elizabeth Weathers.  Timothy Suha appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Attorney Weathers moves for an adjourment.  Defendant is in huber in Ozaukee County.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for October 1, 2015 at 02:30 pm.

Hearing on June 25, 2015 at 09:30 am.
Defendant waives his/her right to a Preliminary Hearing.

Preliminary hearing on May 21, 2015 at 10:00 am.
